abstract: Board of directors for car-parts and service chain Pep Boys unanimously agrees to be acquired by Bridgestone Corp for $947 million, rejecting possibly larger offer from billionaire Carl C Icahn; should Pep Boys accept better offer from another suitor, it would have to pay Bridgestone $39.5 million in termination fees.
lead_paragraph: Pep Boys agreed to be bought by Bridgestone for $947 million, with the board of the car-parts chain deeming the latest offer from the tire company better than a competing bid from Carl Icahn.

headline.main: Pep Boys Accepts Higher Takeover Bid From Bridgestone
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Pep Boys Accepts Takeover Bid by Bridgestone for $947 Million

snippet: Pep Boys agreed to be bought by Bridgestone for $947 million, with the board of the car-parts chain deeming the latest offer from the tire company better than a competing bid from Carl Icahn.
